wikipedia_page.main:
Mark Rice-Oxley is a British journalist. He is an editor and columnist at The Guardian newspaper, whose credits include award-winning work such as WikiLeaks, Qatar's World Cup Slaves 
 and the Shirt on Your Back 
.Rice-Oxley is the author of Underneath the Lemon Tree, an autobiography that describes his journey through depression and recovery.

February 26, 2009.
*Mark Rice-Oxley (born 1969), British journalist, editor and columnist at The Guardian newspaper

In 1997, Jonathan Harmsworth set up The Patricia Rothermere Award in honour of his mother. It was a two-part award and the first part went to Judi Dench in recognition of her services to theatre. The second part was given to promising drama students of that year. In 1997, that went to Mark Rice-Oxley. The award was presented at the Evening Standard Awards show. It was later called the Lady Rothermere Drama Award.
